timeline.bodyText: @santhh Can you give me a hand here? I'm getting IllegalArgumentException here because of the OutputReceiver being parametrized with Iterable instead of KV
timeline.author: mwalenia

timeline.bodyText: Is there a guarantee that at least one element will be in the elementsBag iterator or is there a chance for a NoSuchElementsException on the next() call?
timeline.author: tysonjh

replies.bodyText: I think a check (hasNext) will be helpful. I don't see there will be a case for no such element but possible.
replies.author: santhh

replies.bodyText: Ok, done!
replies.author: mwalenia

timeline.bodyText: Nit: Can you move this to the first line of the if block to avoid splitting the code like this? Also it would be nice to have the unit in the log message for the bufferSize (e.g bytes).
timeline.author: tysonjh

replies.bodyText: Sure, I'll move it and add units. Thanks!
replies.author: mwalenia

timeline.bodyText: Nit: This log message would be more clear if it said the action being taken like.. 'Outputting remaining {} rows'.
timeline.author: tysonjh

replies.bodyText: Done, thanks
replies.author: mwalenia

timeline.bodyText: Can you use DLP_PAYLOAD_LIMIT instead?
timeline.author: tysonjh

replies.bodyText: or the batch size should work. Also 52400 is the max allowed. So we should use something like 52000 for default as there will be some bytes for header.
replies.author: santhh

replies.bodyText: @santhh Is it 52400 or 524000? It should be the latter, since we're setting the limit to 524 kb, I think.
replies.author: mwalenia

replies.bodyText: @santhh Can you weigh in here?
replies.author: mwalenia

timeline.bodyText: Having the units in the name is helpful when the type is non-descriptive. Where did this number come from?
timeline.author: tysonjh

replies.bodyText: Actually this can be taken out. There is a validation that it never goes above 524KB/payload before calling the API. With state/timer based approach,  it's not needed.
replies.author: santhh

replies.bodyText: I agree with Tyson's comment about early validation, I think I'll leave the limits in here.
replies.author: mwalenia

timeline.bodyText: Please add a comment. It would also be beneficial to name this variable with a unit like batchSizeBytes.
timeline.author: tysonjh

timeline.bodyText:
An incorrect configuration should result in an exception at pipeline construction time if possible. The sooner an exception can be raised to the user the better (e.g. pipeline construction vs. pipeline runtime).
A couple options are,

Add precondition checks into the Builder for the AutoValue. You could do this by implementing your own public DLPDeidentifyText build() method the checks preconditions and then calls a generated autoBuild method.
Add precondition checks into the constructor of the DoFn.
timeline.author: tysonjh

replies.bodyText: Thanks for this remark, I added early validation to the code.
replies.author: mwalenia

timeline.bodyText: Since the delimiter is configurable, what about dropping the 'csv'? You could add details in the comments as to where the delimiter applies and the default value.
timeline.author: tysonjh

replies.bodyText: For the delimiter - it's column delimiter.  "," "|" May be rename? Cause row delimiter("\n") is managed by how the records are read using File IO or Text IO.
replies.author: santhh

replies.bodyText: Ok, renamed
replies.author: mwalenia

timeline.bodyText: It would be helpful if these abstract methods, and possibly those in the builder, had comments.
timeline.author: tysonjh

replies.bodyText: Sure, I'll add comments
replies.author: mwalenia

timeline.bodyText: Would you move the comments about how a method works, or what it does, to the method definition please?
timeline.author: tysonjh

replies.bodyText: This will be used for inspect contents for any DLP info types provided in the inspect template. e.g- SSN, US_PASSPORT
replies.author: santhh

replies.bodyText: Are you agreeing that the comments should be moved to the methods, or that the comments are also useful here for the template inspection (I'm unfamiliar with what the 'inspect contents' and 'inspect template' actions)?
replies.author: tysonjh

replies.bodyText: I think moving to the method definition will be more helpful.
replies.author: santhh

timeline.bodyText: See my earlier comment about moving configuration exceptions like this to pipeline construction time. Doing so will give earlier feedback to the user and avoid having to spin up workers and processing part of the pipeline before running into a configuration issue.
timeline.author: tysonjh

timeline.bodyText: What is the expected input? I didn't see where that is mentioned. I think the KV contains a filename key and content string value?
timeline.author: tysonjh

timeline.bodyText:
Is a header required? As a user, if I set a null header, I wouldn't expect to see one in the output.
@santhh do you have an opinion regarding this?
timeline.author: tysonjh

replies.bodyText: no it's not required. If the header is not set, we should assume  request is not table content type just string. True for any request.
replies.author: santhh

replies.bodyText: the header isn't required from the user, but if we want to have the input to DLP Cloud service structured as a table, there needs to be at least 1 header, hence the 'value' added here.
replies.author: mwalenia

replies.bodyText: Correct needs to be one header. How does it know when to use table vs string as content item?
replies.author: santhh

replies.bodyText: or is it two different sub transforms?
replies.author: santhh

replies.bodyText: It's not two subtransforms, input is assumed to be a string if there are no table headers passed as a side input
replies.author: mwalenia

replies.bodyText: got it! perfect.
replies.author: santhh

timeline.bodyText: I wonder if it would be helpful to link to the Cloud DLP content for each type of service for users in these transform comments?
timeline.author: tysonjh

timeline.bodyText:
It's good practice to start all javadoc comments with a short summary fragment. There are more details at Google's java style guide [1]. For example, I would phrase the summary fragment for this class as:
'Batches input rows to reduce the number of requests sent to the Cloud DLP service.'
Would you please go through this CL and add such comments to public classes and methods? I personally like to add them to all classes, non-trivial methods, and tricky blocks of code, regardless of access modifiers.
[1] https://google.github.io/styleguide/javaguide.html#s7.2-summary-fragment
timeline.author: tysonjh

timeline.bodyText: Some places c is used, some places context is used, please pick one and use throughout. I prefer context.
timeline.author: tysonjh

replies.bodyText: Ok, will do!
replies.author: mwalenia

replies.bodyText: Thank you.
replies.author: tysonjh

timeline.bodyText: should this be re-identify?
timeline.author: santhh

replies.bodyText: Right, I'll rename this
replies.author: mwalenia

timeline.bodyText: for re-id inspect template can be optional. only re-id template is required. we should just check if inspect template passed or not. if not take it as valid request.
timeline.author: santhh

replies.bodyText: Thanks!
replies.author: mwalenia

timeline.bodyText: For de-id - it's also same as re-id. de-id template in required but inspect is optional.
timeline.author: santhh

replies.bodyText: Thanks!
replies.author: mwalenia

timeline.message: [BEAM-9723] Add DLP integration transforms
Separate logger for the batching DoFn
Modify the batching algorithm
Rework DLP transforms into more usable forms
Add default GCP project for testing
First batch of fixes after code review
Add javadocs to DLP transforms. Add more tests
Add javadocs to DLP transforms. Add more tests
Add javadocs to DLP transforms. Add more tests

timeline.bodyText:
I think we previously agreed that the term 'csv' here is misleading since it could be any delimiter not just a comma. Perhaps the right name for this is getHeaderColumns()? That would match nicely with getColumnDelimiter, setColumnDelimiter, and setHeaderColumns().
That would follow the style guide from here more closely, though it would require updating other getters to match but the setters in the builder already conform.
timeline.author: tysonjh

replies.bodyText: Right, I must have missed that. Thanks!
replies.author: mwalenia

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/sdks/java/extensions/ml/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/extensions/ml/DLPDeidentifyText.java b/sdks/java/extensions/ml/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/extensions/ml/DLPDeidentifyText.java index 5a239f081a..30fb769873 100644 --- a/sdks/java/extensions/ml/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/extensions/ml/DLPDeidentifyText.java +++ b/sdks/java/extensions/ml/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/extensions/ml/DLPDeidentifyText.java @@ -42,12 +42,12 @@ import org.apache.beam.sdk.values.PCollectionView; /** * A {@link PTransform} connecting to Cloud DLP (https://cloud.google.com/dlp/docs/libraries) and - * deidentifying text according to provided settings. The transform supports both CSV formatted - * input data and unstructured input. + * deidentifying text according to provided settings. The transform supports both columnar delimited + * input data (eg. CSV) and unstructured input. * - *

If the csvHeader property is set and a sideinput with CSV headers is added to the PTransform, - * csvDelimiter also should be set, else the results will be incorrect. If csvHeader is neither set - * nor passed as sideinput, input is assumed to be unstructured. + *

If the headerColumns property is set and a sideinput with table headers is added to the + * PTransform, delimiter also should be set, else the results will be incorrect. If headerColumns is + * neither set nor passed as side input, input is assumed to be unstructured. * *

Either deidentifyTemplateName (String) or deidentifyConfig {@link DeidentifyConfig} need to be * set. inspectTemplateName and inspectConfig ({@link InspectConfig} are optional.

timeline.bodyText:
It seems like the formatting is strange in this class. There aren't empty newlines between methods, did it pass the spotless check?
Also can you apply the comments from previous transforms to this class? For example, dropping the csv, naming getters with a prefix get, ensuring that all preconditions are validated in the build() method.
timeline.author: tysonjh

replies.bodyText: The class passed spotless, I'll reformat it anyway.
replies.author: mwalenia

replies.bodyText: Thank you.
replies.author: tysonjh

replies.bodyText: Sure!

replies.bodyText: Thank you.

Batch size defines how big are batches sent to DLP at once in bytes.

timeline.bodyText:
I'm getting a bit confused at when a header is present and when one isn't now. When building the table for the request to the cloud API, if no header is present, we set one to "value" by default. If that column header ends up in the response, should this method also return "value" when set to null?
If that is the case, this needs to be clear in the comments somewhere.
timeline.author: tysonjh

replies.bodyText: I don't think this should return "value" if there's no header from the user, this property is for user-defined headers only and I don't think there's need to return the defaults anyway. We'd need to evaluate existence of the sideinput in the internal DoFn anyway, so there wouldn't be much gain in terms of code complexity anyway.
replies.author: mwalenia

replies.bodyText: OK, sounds good.
replies.author: tysonjh

The transform supports both CSV formatted - * input data and unstructured input. + * deidentifying text according to provided settings. The transform supports both columnar delimited + * input data (eg. CSV) and unstructured input. * - *

If the csvHeader property is set and a sideinput with CSV headers is added to the PTransform, - * csvDelimiter also should be set, else the results will be incorrect. If csvHeader is neither set - * nor passed as sideinput, input is assumed to be unstructured. + *

If the headerColumns property is set and a sideinput with table headers is added to the + * PTransform, delimiter also should be set, else the results will be incorrect. If headerColumns is + * neither set nor passed as side input, input is assumed to be unstructured. * *

timeline.message: Get rid of CSV mentions
Rename getters to get*
Add delimiter requirement check to builders. Formatting in DLPInspectText
Add test of mapping delimited rows, verify table headers in deidentification
Add tests for preconditions in DLP transforms
Add more preconditions with tests
Change default GCP project name
Add info to CHANGES.md
Merge branch 'master' into BEAM-9723-java-dlp

timeline.bodyText: Does it make sense to move the creation of client in startBundle? Just commenting for overall all three use cases.
timeline.author: santhh

replies.bodyText: We can move it to startBundle or to setup and close the client in teardown.
replies.author: mwalenia

timeline.message: Move initialization of dlpServiceClient to setup/teardown methods
Merge branch 'BEAM-9723-java-dlp' of github.com:apache/beam into BEAM-9723-java-dlp

timeline.bodyText: @mwalenia Hi Michal- I have tried with 2.23 snapshot yesterday. Do you think it was missed to pass on the side input in this step? like .withSideInputs(headerColumns)
timeline.author: santhh

replies.bodyText: Thanks for your keen eye, it must have slipped our minds during review to check for the side input here. I'll try to get this fixed and ready for 2.23.
replies.author: mwalenia

replies.bodyText: Thank you.
replies.author: santhh
